cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (forecast to become Category 1 before landfall)
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana and 120 mi WSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: slowly northwest overnight, then turning north on Saturday – tracking toward the south-central Louisiana coast and then up the Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City / Vermilion Bay

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (and Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle
weather_observation.warning_coast: Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas including metropolitan New Orleans; Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City LA eastward to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57+ mph) likely tonight through Saturday; brief hurricane-force gusts possible in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible on Lake Pontchartrain and adjacent tidal rivers, including the New Orleans waterfront.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches with locally 25 inches possible, producing life-threatening flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; prolonged river flooding along the Mississippi and back-bay flooding could hamper port operations.
